creditline: Gift of H.M. Lissauer, Melbourne, Australia
description: cone-shaped hammered cup with naturalistic vines, branches, 3 leaves and a bunch of grapes along sides; branches form a tripod stand that holds up cup
markings: on outer branch, stamped: [(3 squares with symbols) 925 (inside a circle)]
text: The naturalistic elements (here grapevines on a wine cup) and hand-hammered surface are typical of Marshall's work, which includes secular jewelry and hollowware in addition to Judaica.
title: Kiddush (sanctification) cup
